text: Sir Ivan Roy Callan, KCVO, CMG (born 1942) is a retired British diplomat. Educated at University College, Oxford, Callan joined the Foreign and Commonwealth Office (FCO) in 1969"Callan, Sir Ivan", Who's Who (online ed., Oxford University Press, December 2018). Retrieved 18 July 2019. and was appointed to HM Diplomatic Service in 1972.The London Gazette, 8 August 1972 (issue 45747), p. 9449. He was appointed Consul-General at the British Embassy in Baghdad in 1983 and then moved to Jerusalem where he was Consul-General from 1987 to 1990. After returning to the FCO, he was appointed High Commissioner of Brunei (1994–98) and then Ambassador to Oman, serving from 1999 until retirement in 2002. Callan was appointed a Companion of the Order of St Michael and St George in the 1990 Birthday Honours.The London Gazette, 15 June 1990 (issue 52173), p. 3. He was also appointed a Knight Commander of the Royal Victorian Order in September 1998.The London Gazette, 16 October 1998, notice L-55283-1SI. == References == Category:Living people Category:1942 births Category:British diplomats Category:Alumni of University College, Oxford Category:Knights Commander of the Royal Victorian Order Category:Companions of the Order of St Michael and St George
title: Ivan Callan
